    A list of 205 national and international academic meetings in various disciplines for key features of inclusivity and sustainability and propose solutions to make conferences more modern, effective, equitable and intellectually productive for the research community and environmentally sustainable for our planet.

  • Created by eLife Community Ambassadors

EMBO meetings (EMBO has joined the American Society for Cell Biology for their annual meeting.)

Conference year: 2018

Total years: 57

Disciplines: Life Sciences

Gender balance: None

Attendance cost: $2000-$4000

Registration fee: $100-$655

Carbon footprint (tons of CO2): 2250

Other carbon footprint (tons of CO2): 450

Society name: European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL)

Society members: 1800

Attendees: 1500

Venue: Eurpean countries

Frequency: Annual

Sponsors:

Virtual option: None

Digital archives: None

Electronic program dissemination:

On-site maternity: None

On-site childcare: None

Caregiver grant: Yes (Organizers of EMBO events can allocate funds to offset additional child care costs incurred by participants or speakers when participating at any EMBO funded meeting. Up to â‚¬1000 are provided for each course or workshop in addition to the core funding awarded. Eligible costs include fees for a baby-sitter or child-care facility, travel costs for a care giver, or travel costs for taking the child to the meeting etc. The selection is handled by the organisers of the respective meetings.)

Career development: ASCB workshops (joint annual meeting with ASCB)

ECR promotion events: Yes (he EMBO Young Scientists Forum brings together EMBO Installation Grantees, EMBO Young Investigators and PhD students and postdoctoral researchers for an overview of the latest development in the life sciences.)

Travel awards: Yes (A limited number of travel grants is available for eligible participants who are selected to attend EMBO Workshops, EMBO Practical Courses, EMBO | FEBS Lecture Courses, EMBO | EMBL Symposia.)

Code of conduct: https://www.embo-embl-symposia.org/info_participants/terms/index.html

Safety instructions: None

Environmental sustainability: None

Public engagement: None

Sustainability initiatives: None
